author: Ella Dennis
comment: It SUCKS you hav to have cumputer

reply.author: OleJon.net
reply.content: Can you please give more feedback? The description clearly states this is a remote control for Spotify for computers running Linux (not Windows or Mac OS). Please do not give bad reviews without reading the description in Google Play Store before you download. The app is free, no ads and it is open source and I have used hundreds of hours on it.

author: Calipanhead
comment: I reverted to the old Spotify version and it works flawlessly.  Next paycheck I'll be donating!  One thing that would be nice to add is the radio tab.  On the PC and Mobile version i have recently listened to radio stations based on tracks.  If that could be implemented it would be even better.  But again, it's fantastic!  Thank you so much!

reply.author: OleJon.net
reply.content: Thanks! Unfortunately there is no radio in the web API yet, at least. So nothing I can do about that particular feature request as of now.

title: Excellent!

author: Rahul Bharti
comment: Never has an app given me more than I asked for. It's got lyrics, your whole Spotify profile and everything. Wonderful. Just wonderful. I am sorry I can't make a donation since I am broke myself(college student), but I am sending my love. Keep up the great work.

reply.author: OleJon.net
reply.content: Thanks!

title: Just brilliant

comment: Really good! Before you guys whine just remember it doesn't on latest Spotify

reply.content: Thanks :-) It partially supports v 1.0

author: Floris Assies
comment: I hate having to install things on Spotify but I love the Spotify connect function which I couldn't use on my Ubuntu laptop. This solved the problem in 2 minutes. Excellent. So far no bugs
title: no problem installing, works like a charm!

author: Ankur Khanna
comment: Its almost the best remote control. If only it had better playlist playback. But no complaints at all for the huge contribution...
title: Great for a remote control. Still...

author: Vincent Hahn
comment: Pretty good

author: Sean Sullivan
comment: I just built a brand new HTPC (linux, everything is linux in my house) and had hoped to make use of the Spotify Connect feature but quickly learned it's not yet implemented in the Linux client. This solves that problem! The dameon installs easily, adds itself to startup, and just plain works. I've only had a few hours using the Android controller but so far so good. I used to be SQA so I notice issues with a quickness and thus far I am happy. I'm sure I'll find some usability gripes soon enough, but that goes for any software ;)

reply.author: OleJon.net
reply.content: Thanks! These are words that inspire me to develop free and open source applications. I hope you can consider donating a small amount of money. You can do it easily in the app.

title: Very nice!

author: Floris van Kooten
comment: This is a brilliant workaround for the sloppy Linux support Spotify gives us. The app works like in should, flawless and quick. Just one question: will you be able to put in a scrollbar to scroll down the track? That would be so awesome! I'll see if I can donate some to you in a few days. :)

reply.author: OleJon.net
reply.content: Thanks! If you by scrollbar mean seeking in the currently playing song, it is not possible through D-Bus, unfortunately. It is out of my control. If Spotify enabled it in D-Bus I would implement it immediately.

title: Awesome!

author: Nicole Hammond
comment: Repurposed an old Windows netbook with a dead keyboard by installing a lightweight Linux OS, now it's hidden out of sight streaming Spotify to a vintage amp via a decent DAC. Excellent sound quality for minimal expenditure. SpotCommander works perfectly, with a load of features. I like how I can even turn the PC off directly from the app.

comment: I really like this app :D Very easy to get it working and to use. Feels a little sluggish at times but apart from that perfect!
